heisig_chinese_memo: Male is seen here as muscles working in the field, in other words working in the rice fields is the work of the male who are usually stronger. This is more or less the meaning of the original Chinese character.
heisig_constituent: male, rice field, brains, power, muscle, arnold
heisig_story: Rice fields . . . power. This character is the gender-specific man, not the generic human person of frame 951.
koohiiStory1: Male is seen here as muscles working in the field, in other words working in the rice fields is the work of the male who are usually stronger. This is more or less the meaning of the original Chinese character.
koohiiStory2: When it comes to choosing a MAN, I prefer brains over muscles.
jp_example_words:
男の人(おとこのひと): man
男子(だんし): youth, young man
長男(ちょうなん): eldest son

jp_readingExamples: 男子 (だんし), 男女 (だんじょ), 男性 (だんせい), 男 (おとこ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Rice paddy power comes from a man. One man, in fact. He's running on a big wheel next to the rice paddy and providing all of the power for the rice to grow and be harvested.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the power this man is generating! Now look at the next rice paddy and you'll see it's on a different power grid with a different man powering it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: A man can power an entire rice paddy until dawn (だん). Once dawn comes they need a little break, so they nap. But once dawn is over, they're back at it again!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the man watching as the first light of dawn tints the color of the sky, turning it pink and orange. He stops working, lays down, and falls asleep.
Ru_trainchinese: nán: (сущ) мужчина; сын, мальчик; барон
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the power (力) in the rice field (田) comes from a male
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Male is seen here as muscles working in the field, in other words working in the rice fields is the work of the male who are usually stronger. This is more or less the meaning of the original Chinese character.
origin_of_ch_char_book: There are some mysterious commonalities in cultures from different parts of the world. In many cultures, including East and West, “right hand” came to mean positive while the “left hand” came to mean something negative. In China, when one says “you are thinking Left”, it refers to wrong thinking. Right hand (右, you, right) used to mean “help with god’s hands”. Left hand (左, zuo, left) also used to mean “help of god”. Both symbols used to mean “sacred help from god” but now the meaning has changed to “right” and “left”. The respect to the right is reflected in the difference of these two symbols. (口, kou, mouse) in the character of the right means ‘order’, and (工, gong, worker; industry). In the character meaning ‘left,’ it means just a ‘tool (ruler)’ or ‘support’. (力, li, power) means the power of the right hand. And if a field is added on this character (男, nan, man), it means a man who cultivates farmland.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jin inscription from " field " to " force ", " force " is like Lei Lei, will use Lei Lei to cultivate in the field. Because the farmer is male, " male " is used as the name of a man (Xu Zhongshu).

Oracle means men's clothing. Bronze text also means men's clothing, ancient noble name. Ling Fangyi: "Hou, Tian (dian), male". "book. "Kanggao": "Hou, Dian, Man, Bang, Cai, Wei." Kong Chuan: "Men's clothes go to the king city for two thousand miles." Also, Qi Hou Pan: "Men and women have no time." It also means that the son, "Hundred men, hundreds of daughters, and thousands of grandchildren" is also used as a personal name to hang the father of the father: "The father of the father is Huo Ji left (媵) it (匜).

"Shuowen": "Husbands. Congli from Tian. Yanmen use force on Tianya. All males are from males." Duan Yucai's note: "A man is a ten meter long, so he is called a husband. Bai Hutong said: " Male, Ren also. Ren, meritorious." Gu Nan is the same as Ren." See " Ren ".
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " Tian " to " Power ", " Power " is like Lei Lei, which means Lei Lei will be used for farming in the field. Because the farmer is male, " male " is used as the name of a man (Xu Zhongshu).
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「田」從「力」，「力」象耒耜形，會用耒耜於田中耕作之意。因農耕者為男性，故以「男」作為男子的稱呼(徐中舒)。

　　甲骨文表示男服。金文亦表示男服，古爵名。令方彝：「侯、田(甸)、男」。《書．康誥》：「侯、甸、男、邦、采、衛。」孔傳：「男服去王城二千里。」又表示男子，齊侯盤：「男女無期」。又表示兒子，翏生盨：「百男百女千孫」，又用作人名，弔男父匜：「弔男父乍為霍姬賸(媵)它(匜)。」

　　《說文》：「丈夫也。从田从力。言男用力於田也。凡男之屬皆从男。」段玉裁注：「人長一丈，故曰丈夫。白虎通曰：『男，任也。任，功業也。』古男與任同音。」參見「任」。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「田」從「力」，「力」象耒耜形，會用耒耜於田中耕作之意。因農耕者為男性，故以「男」作為男子的稱呼(徐中舒)。

甲金文從「 田 」從「 力 」，「 力 」象耒耜形，會用耒耜於田中耕作之意。因農耕者為男性，故以「 男 」作為男子的稱呼(徐中舒)。 甲骨文表示男服。金文亦表示男服，古爵名。令方彝：「侯、田(甸)、男」。《書．康誥》：「侯、甸、男、邦、采、衛。」孔傳：「男服去王城二千里。」又表示男子，齊侯盤：「男女無期」。又表示兒子，翏生盨：「百男百女千孫」，又用作人名，弔男父匜：「弔男父乍為霍姬賸(媵)它(匜)。」 《說文》：「丈夫也。从田从力。言男用力於田也。凡男之屬皆从男。」段玉裁注：「人長一丈，故曰丈夫。白虎通曰：『男，任也。任，功業也。』古男與任同音。」參見「 任 」。

Oracle means men's clothing. Bronze text also means men's clothing, ancient noble name. Ling Fangyi: "Hou, Tian (dian), male". "book. "Kanggao": "Hou, Dian, Man, Bang, Cai, Wei." Kong Chuan: "Men's clothes go to the king city for two thousand miles." Also, Qi Hou Pan: "Men and women have no time." It also means that the son, "Hundred men, hundreds of daughters, and thousands of grandchildren" is also used as a personal name to hang the father of the father: "The father of the father is Huo Ji left (媵) it (匜). "Shuowen": "Husbands. Congli from Tian. Yanmen use force on Tianya. All males are from males." Duan Yucai's note: "A man is a ten meter long, so he is called a husband. Bai Hutong said: " Male, Ren also. Ren, meritorious." Gu Nan is the same as Ren." See " Ren".

男字的基本解释

男
nán
阳性的人：男性。男人。男孩。男女平等。
儿子：长（zh僴g ）男。
封建制度五等爵位的第五等：男爵。
女

男字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nán］
［《廣韻》那含切，平覃，泥。］
亦作“侽1”。
(1)男子；男性的人。与“女”相对。
(2)指男性。
(3)特指能从事劳动的青壮年男子。
(4)儿子。
(5)儿子对父母的自称。
(6)古代爵位名。五等爵的第五等。《礼记·王制》：“王者之制禄爵，公、侯、伯、子、男，凡五等。”《公羊传·隐公五年》：“天子三公稱公，王者之後稱公，其餘大國稱侯，小國稱伯、子、男。”徐彦疏：“公地方五百里，侯四百里，伯三百里，子二百里，男一百里。”《汉书·翟义传》：“莽乃并録，以小大爲差，封侯伯子男凡三百九十五人。”清代亦以称第二品爵位。
(7)指古代“五服”、“九服”之一的“男服”。
(8)指具备男子的性功能。

男字的英文翻译

◎ 男
he, male, man, son

男字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【田字部】　男； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页759第02
【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?那含切，音南。【說文】丈夫也。从田从力，言用力於田也。【白虎通】男，任也。任，功業也。【易·繫辭】乾道成男。　又爵名。【禮·王制】公侯伯子男，凡五等。　又姓。【史記·夏本紀】其後有男氏。　又【韻補】叶尼心切，音寧。【詩·大雅】太娰嗣徽音，則百斯男。

男字的源字形

男字的起名意思

：指男性，男人、有德行的男子，如男德。

male
Basic explanation of words
male
nán
Positive person: male. the man. boy. Gender equality.
Son: Long (zh僴g) male.
The fifth class of the fifth class of the feudal system: the baron.
Female
male
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [nán]
["Guangyun" Na Hanqie, Pingtan, Clay. ]
Also known as "侽1".
(1) Men; male people. Contrast with "female".
(2) Refers to men.
(3) Especially young men who can do work.
(4) Son.
(5) The son's claim to his parents.
(6) Ancient titles. The fifth class of the fifth class. "Book of Rites · King System": "The king's rule of the lords, the prince, the marquis, the uncle, the son, the male, and the five etc." , The other big countries are called Hou, and the small countries are called Bo, Zi, and Male." Xu Yanshu: "The public is five hundred miles, Hou is four hundred miles, Bo is three hundred miles, Zi is two hundred miles, and male is one hundred miles." "Book·Zhai Yi Biography": "Mang is recorded together, with small and big as the difference, 395 people named Hou Bozi male." Also known as the second rank in the Qing Dynasty.
(7) Refers to the "men's clothes", one of the ancient "five clothes" and "nine clothes".
(8) Refers to having male sexual function.
male

◎ Male
he, male, man, son
male
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection] [Tian Zi Department] 　男; Kangxi strokes: 7; Page number: page 759 02
[Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? That Hanqie, Yinnan. [Said Wen] Husband too. Congtian Congli, the language is hard for Tian also. [Baihutong] Male, Ren Ye. Ren, meritorious. [Yi·Ci] The leading role becomes a man.　Also noble name. [Rite·Royal System] Gonghou Bozinan, where the fifth class.　Another last name. [Historical Records·Xia Benji] Then there was a man.　[Rhyme Replenishment] Ye Ni is eager, Yinning. 【Poetry·Daya】Taishi Huiyin, Baisi male.
male
Source glyph
male
Name meaning
: Refers to men, men, virtuous men, such as men's virtuousness.
男
nán
字由“四”、“力”两部分构成。
“カ”就是古农具“来”(音1ei,参
见“力”字条)。在四里耕作是古代
男人的主要职责,因此用“田”、
“カ”来表示“男人”。
田
мужчина
Слово состоит из двух частей: «четыре» и «сила».
«Ка» - это древний сельскохозяйственный инструмент «Лай» (звук 1ei, см. Примечание «力»).
Земледелие в Сили было основной обязанностью древних людей, поэтому «тянь» и «ка» использовались для обозначения «мужчин».
поле
nán
I сущ.
1) мужчина, муж; мужского пола, мужской
男女平等 равенство мужчины и женщины
男学生 учащийся мужского пола
2) сын (также о себе при обращении к родителям)
男在外平安, 勿用挂念 ваш сын на чужбине находится в полном здравии, не беспокойтесь
生一男 родить сына
3) молодой человек; совершеннолетний, трудообязанный
民有二男以上，则… те жители, у которых два или более трудоспособных члена семьи...
4) нань (пятый, младший титул знати при маньчжурах, соответствующий баронскому титулу)
公侯伯子男五等 пять степеней знатности: гун, хоу, бо, цзы, нань
5) ист. третья зона земель (в 2000 ли от столицы, см. 男服)
II собств.
Нань (фамилия)

男

Значения

Мужчина

Мнемоника


Лишь у мужчины хватает силы 力, чтобы обработать поле 田.

Radicals: 田, 力  (rice-paddy, power)
Meaning Mnemonic
Rice paddy power comes from a man. One man, in fact. He's running on a big wheel next to the rice paddy and providing all of the power for the rice to grow and be harvested.
Picture the power this man is generating! Now look at the next rice paddy and you'll see it's on a different power grid with a different man powering it.
Reading Mnemonic
A man can power an entire rice paddy until dawn (だん). Once dawn comes they need a little break, so they nap. But once dawn is over, they're back at it again!
Picture the man watching as the first light of dawn tints the color of the sky, turning it pink and orange. He stops working, lays down, and falls asleep.

力 (сила), 田 (рисовое поле)
